title: Survey Method Design for Analyzing Awareness and Impact of AI Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Statistics and Research Methodology
context.additional_context: A survey design and implementation learning program for graduate students in science, analyzing the current status of AI tool utilization

learning_goals: Within two weeks, learners validate content validity (CVI ≥ 0.78) and internal consistency reliability (Cronbach’s α ≥ 0.70) for one questionnaire on AI tool utilization targeting graduate students and propose at least three item improvement plans reflecting expert feedback.

Learners analyze the social impact of AI tools using quantitative data (experimental results, numerical statistics) and qualitative data (user feedback, case studies), and write a 5-page report (introduction-methodology-results-discussion-references structure) including at least three data visualizations (graphs/tables) and five or more references.

Learners collect AI tool utilization data by gender (male/female) and major (engineering/humanities-social sciences), generate at least three visualization charts (bar graphs, heatmaps, box plots) using Python’s Pandas and Matplotlib libraries, and analyze pattern differences.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
